content: What classification of marine mammals do humpback, gray, and blue whales belong to? Please refer to the table below for more information.

Humpback whales, gray whales, and blue whales all belong to the classification of marine mammals known as "baleen whales." More scientifically, they are part of the suborder Mysticeti. Baleen whales are characterized by having baleen plates instead of teeth, which they use to filter feed on small organisms like krill and plankton from the water.
